speakers.name: Jesse Arneson
speakers.title: Founder, Welcome Stranger
speakers.bio: We're excited to feature Jesse Arneson, co-founder of Welcome Stranger ‚Äî a Hawai'i-based brand identity studio that specializes in branding, design, and digital experiences. They focus on creating engaging design and strategy for companies that want more. Jesse Arneson is known for pushing the boundaries of design and storytelling, Jesse's work shapes authentic, culturally grounded experiences. Join us as Jesse and Welcome Stranger's cofounder Scott Na'auao talk about designing with Aloha, and share insights on the roles and responsibilities of design in Hawai'i.

speakers.name: Kuhao Zane
speakers.title: Creative Director, szkaiao
speakers.bio: Kuhao Zane, Creative Director of Sig Zane Designs and SZKaiao comes from a generational Hula family practice that grounds and informs his day to day career. Zane has worked with his father, company founder Sig Zane for the past 21 years, from sweeping sidewalks to opening two Oahu locations, Sig On Smith and Kaiao_Space. With his design studio SZKaiao, Kuhao employs their unique approach that blends cultural values with design. Their work with both local and international clients range from branding, art installations, airplane liveries and architectural way-finding.

speakers.name: Scott Na'auao
speakers.title: Founder, Welcome Stranger
speakers.bio: We're excited to feature Scott Na'auao, co-founder of Welcome Stranger ‚Äî a Hawai'i-based brand identity studio that specializes in branding, design, and digital experiences. They focus on creating engaging design and strategy for companies that want more. Scott Na'auao's passion for weaving Native Hawaiian culture into design brings a unique, meaningful approach to every project. Join us as Scott and Welcome Stranger's cofounder Jesse Arneson talk about designing with Aloha, and share insights on the roles and responsibilities of design in Hawai'i.

speakers.name: Arthur Grau
speakers.title: Service Design Strategist, Intellibridge
speakers.bio: Every problem is a design problem. As designers we empathetically synthesize human and systemic challenges to build user solutions, engagement, and delight. With Intellibridge, the U.S. Govt., MIT, and as a lifelong mindfulness practitioner and founder of at250.org, Arthur brings awareness-based practices to bear on experience design challenges.

speakers.name: Cedar Lay
speakers.title: PhD student and Web Production Editor, UH MƒÅnoa
speakers.bio: Cedar is an experienced design professional and a PhD student of Linguistics, combining his professional and academic backgrounds to build impactful narratives and address real world issues. His work with Indigenous and non-dominant communities seeks to preserve and revitalize endangered languages through strategic design practices.

speakers.name: Chaelin Ryu
speakers.title: Freelance UX Designer
speakers.bio: Chaelin Ryu is an emerging UX researcher and designer with a background in marketing.  With a knack for uncovering hidden insights and a love for collaboration, she hopes to make the digital world a bit more user-friendly and a lot more fun!

speakers.name: Chanae Evans
speakers.title: Senior UX Designer, AT&T
speakers.bio: Chanae's passion for Interactive storytelling through powerful experiences inspired her to pursue a career in user experience design. She brings 7+ years of design experience driving engagement in e-commerce, SaaS, and native apps for Android and IOs. Based in Seattle, Chanae gives back by being a mentor for Pi ªik≈´ Co.

speakers.name: Emily Shi Lee
speakers.title: Senior UX Writer, Codecademy
speakers.bio: Emily Shi Lee is an intensely curious UX content designer and information architect. By day, she designs with words at Codecademy. By night, she designs with clay.

speakers.name: Ikelau Misech
speakers.title: Pacific Island Research Intern, Pacific Island Development Program
speakers.bio:
We‚Äôre excited to feature Scott Na‚Äòauao, co-founder of Welcome Stranger ‚Äî a Hawai‚Äòi-based brand identity studio that specializes in branding, design, and digital experiences. They focus on creating engaging design and strategy for companies that want more. üôå üé§‚ú®

speakers.name: Jennifer Ano
speakers.title: Board Advisor, Wahine Freelance Alliance
speakers.bio: Jennifer Ano is an advisor to Wahine Freelance Alliance. She has a long career in the corporate world and is an early in career freelancer. Born in Honolulu, Hawaii, she currently lives in Portland, Oregon.

speakers.name: Jennifer Kumura
speakers.title: Co-Founder, UXHI
speakers.bio: Jenn is a co-founder of UXHI and a proud partner and supporter of Pi ªik≈´ Co. By day, she is a product design manager at Servco Pacific Inc. Jenn is passionate about elevating human-centered design here in Hawai ªi and creating job opportunities for kama ªaina and kanaka.

speakers.name: Kim Davidson
speakers.title: Product Leader, Freelance
speakers.bio: Kim has worked in social impact tech for 15 years, including website and app builds for nonprofits, government, and political organizations. She currently contracts as a fractional product leader while building Pi ªik≈´ Co., a nonprofit helping local people launch technology careers.

speakers.name: Krizel Tomines
speakers.title: UX Researcher, Majesco
speakers.bio: Krizel Tomines is a passionate UX researcher who combines her love for technology and social justice to amplify human voices, advocating for ethical and inclusive designs that prioritize the needs and fairness of users.

speakers.name: Martin Caprile
speakers.title: UX/UI Designer, Martin Caprile
speakers.bio: Martin‚Äôs passion for creating impactful digital experiences inspired him to pursue a career in UX/UI design. With years of experience in photography and a B.A. in Communications, he brings a creative and technical approach to designing user-friendly, visually engaging products. Based in Hawai'i, Martin is a Pi'ik≈´ Alumni from Cohort 3, actively growing his skills and sharing his knowledge.

speakers.name: May Sermonia
speakers.title: Program Director, Pi ªik≈´ Co.
speakers.bio: Based in Hawai'i, May is a human-centered product designer and founder of Pi ªik≈´ Co., with 8+ years of experience helping startups launch and scale. With expertise in tech, design, and collaboration, May connects people and ideas, empowering the local community to thrive in the tech space.

speakers.name: Mei Jeanne Wagner
speakers.title: Vice President, Anthology FINN Partners
speakers.bio: Mei Jeanne is a seasoned marketing and PR professional with deep ties to Hawai‚Äòi's multicultural community. She has led award-winning campaigns for local and national clients, specializing in effective communication strategies. With a strong connection to Native Hawaiian culture, Mei Jeanne bridges cultural knowledge and modern marketing expertise.

speakers.name: Nicolas Kim
speakers.title: Product Designer, Lady Bandit Studios
speakers.bio: Nic is a product designer with a background in medical device engineering design. He is a Pi ªik≈´ Co. cohort 2 alumni and is in the midst of finding a first full-time role as a product designer.

speakers.name: Rich Matsuura
speakers.title: Founder, ProductPOV Previously VP of Product and UX
speakers.bio: Rich co-founded PandaTree and Crowdera, and was VP of Product and Design at Dispatch. At eBay, he was Director of Product, leading the Seller Experience team to drive innovation. Now, he‚Äôs leading an AI startup to help non-technical founders quickly launch working prototypes and find product-market fit.

speakers.name: Shannon Manamtam
speakers.title: UX Designer, Anthology - FINN Parnters
speakers.bio: Shannon was born and raised in Honolulu, and graduated with BAs in Journalism and Communications from the University of Hawaii at Manoa. She has worked in UX and digital marketing at Anthology - FINN Partners for over 4 years, and currently serves as a board member for Ad 2 Hawaii.

speakers.name: Umit Gokce
speakers.title: Principal Product Designer, Empathico LLC / The Boeing Company
speakers.bio: Umit is a UX and product designer with 15+ years experience including leading design teams at Boeing and Microsoft and founding/co-founding startups in sports, healthcare and wellness education. He also facilitated design workshops for Fortune 500 companies, the Gates Foundation and other nonprofits and institutions including the University of Washington.

speakers.name: Bryan Wu
speakers.title: Senior Product / UX Designer, Consultant @ Wu & Associates
speakers.bio: Bryan Wu is a seasoned product design consultant based in the San Francisco Bay Area with over 24 years of experience. Specializing in app design, particularly for iOS, Bryan has worked with a wide range of clients across industries including social networks, finance, and medical. His impressive portfolio includes collaborations with major tech companies like Google, Visa, Skype, Samsung, and E*Trade, as well as startups and non-profits such as the Monterey Bay Aquarium. Bryan excels in consumer-facing products, service design, and early-stage concept development. He is also the lead designer for la.foodoasis.net, a volunteer-run free meal and food pantry directory, where he manages a design team, mentors, and provides product direction. In addition to his consulting work, Bryan enjoys iOS programming in his spare time.

speakers.name: Hana Morrison
speakers.title: Founder & Lead Designer, Sunnyside Studio
speakers.bio: Hana fell in love with branding in college and has been committed to the craft ever since. She has designed for brands near and far, from Hawaiian Airlines and Hanahau ªoli Schools, to Vans, Dell, Hot Wheels, and Disney. Today, she‚Äôs carving her own path: running a boutique design studio that serves clients worldwide, while traveling the world as a digital nomad. Her services span from brand strategy, to identity design, and activation through packaging, digital marketing, print collateral, and more. With a degree in Entrepreneurship, Hana is positioned at the intersection of design and business. She keeps a curious mindset, and an appetite to learn, and is always excited to connect with like-minded creatives.

speakers.name: Joe Baranowski
speakers.title: Creative Director, Purple Mai'a
speakers.bio:
We‚Äôre excited to feature Scott Na‚Äòauao, co-founder of Welcome Stranger ‚Äî a Hawai‚Äòi-based brand identity studio that specializes in branding, design, and digital experiences. They focus on creating engaging design and strategy for companies that want more. üôå üé§‚ú®

speakers.name: Eln√© Jenkins
speakers.title: Creative Director, Purple Mai'a
speakers.bio: Eln√© is a results-driven Product and UX/UI Designer with a knack for creating intuitive B2B and B2C SaaS solutions, as well as sleek websites and app interfaces. With expertise in user research, journey mapping, and prototyping, she excels at turning business ideas into successful products. Originally from Johannesburg, South Africa, Eln√© moved to New York City in 2016 to pursue her studies and now resides in Honolulu, Hawai‚Äôi with her husband and a thriving collection of house plants. She loves collaborating with cross-functional teams to bring innovative designs to life!
